anxiety.diagnosis: The system detects hyper-activation in the Amygdala. Your neural safety-check mechanism is currently bypassing the Prefrontal Cortex's logic gate.

General.action: Physiological sigh (2 inhales, 1 long exhale) x 5.

Social.action: Engage in 2 minutes of low-stakes social observation.

focus.diagnosis: Insufficient signal-to-noise ratio in the Prefrontal Cortex (PFC). Tonic dopamine levels are below the required threshold for sustained attention.

Work.action: Identify 1 macro-goal; eliminate all digital notifications.

distraction.diagnosis: Failure in the frontal eye fields (FEF) and dlPFC to filter environmental noise. Your brain is struggling to maintain a high signal-to-noise ratio.

General.action: Visual focus exercise: Stare at a single point for 60s without blinking.

indecision.diagnosis: Metabolic overload in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (dlPFC). The neural cost of comparing variables is exceeding current glucose availability.

General.action: Use '2-minute rule': If a choice takes >120s, pick the first option immediately.

avolition.diagnosis: Reward-prediction error in the Anterior Cingulate Cortex (ACC). The brain is failing to allocate metabolic energy for future-oriented tasks.

General.action: Break the task into a 2-minute micro-action to bypass the ACC energy-gate.

rigidity.diagnosis: Update delay in the Orbitofrontal Cortex (OFC). Your neural circuits are sticking to old rules despite environmental changes.

General.action: Perform a small routine task in a completely new way to force neuroplasticity.

disinhibition.diagnosis: Weakened inhibitory signaling from the ventromedial Prefrontal Cortex (vmPFC). Socially inappropriate or impulsive outputs are bypassing the moral gate.

General.action: Implement a mandatory 3-second 'internal filter' delay before any verbal output.

lability.diagnosis: Failure of top-down inhibitory control from the PFC to the Amygdala. Your executive brain is failing to regulate primitive emotional pulses.

General.action: Perform 4-7-8 rhythmic breathing to manually re-engage the parasympathetic system.

self_monitoring.diagnosis: Dysfunction in the Frontopolar Cortex. The brain's 'observer' circuit is lagging, preventing accurate self-correction of behaviors.

General.action: Narrate your current actions out loud to force auditory-based self-processing.

memory.diagnosis: Hippocampal signaling interference detected. High cortisol levels are likely disrupting the encoding of new synaptic connections.

General.action: Utilize spaced repetition and prioritize 7+ hours of sleep for consolidation.

burnout.diagnosis: Chronic down-regulation of D2 receptors in the Striatum. The brain is entering a hypo-metabolic state to prevent further neural damage.

General.action: Complete sensory deprivation (dark room) for 30 minutes.

cravings.diagnosis: Supra-physiological dopamine spikes in the Ventral Tegmental Area (VTA). Your reward prediction error mechanism is currently hijacked.

General.action: 48-hour dopamine fast. Remove all visual environmental triggers.

procrastination.diagnosis: Limbic system (immediate reward) winning over the Prefrontal Cortex (delayed reward). Neural conflict in the Anterior Cingulate Cortex (ACC).

General.action: 5-minute rule: Commit to the task for exactly 300 seconds.

fear.diagnosis: Periaqueductal Gray (PAG) activation. The brain is shifting from high-order thinking to primitive freeze/flight mode.

General.action: Box breathing (4-4-4-4) to re-engage the Vagus nerve signals.
